subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1203363111
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Very true ...........  As its inventor he would have to explain in  detail 
how his invention works.  Lets see him worm his way out of that  one.
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008 1:30:28 P.M. Central Standard Time,  
warrior18eii@... writes:

 
 
 
 
That  would be interesting to know. Then again, I really don't wanna get 
wrapped up  in Chris's little world. I don't know, it may turn out to be a 
blessing that  Chris is made the inventor of "Frank's Box" if world wide exposure on 
TV goes  bad.

Regards,

Frank R.

-----  Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@From: "Marlbo<Marlboro63@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Sent:  Monday, February 18, 2008 1:23:57 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box  on Paranormal State Tonight


Should write A&E and ask them  if Chris Moon is charging them $7.50 a minute 
to do his box session.  And  explain is as that is what he charges the general 
public to do a box  session.  Or rather 30 minutes is $250.00 and if you want 
to ask  questions yourself then it is an additional $50.00.  Would be nice to 
see  if he is doing it GRATTUS or he has made financial arrangements with  
them.  Just a thought.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008  1:18:49 P.M. Central Standard Time, 
warrior18eii@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)  writes:

 
 
 
 
I don't know. I hope Chris wasn't stupid  enough to claim it. I don't think 
so because he has displayed to us all that  he knows what slander, liable, 
defamation and outright lying means. You  wouldn't think that a network would be 
so careless but then again Paranormal  State is lacking a lot in the research 
dept.

Don't get me wrong, it  is entertaining. I can't stop laughing all the way  
through.

Regards,

Frank R.

----- Original Message ----
From:  "Marlboro63@ _aol.com_ (http://aol.com/) " <Marlboro63@aol. com>
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 1:13:31  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State  Tonight


Hi Frank,
 
I just wonder where they got the idea that  Chris Moon was the inventor?  
They wouldn't of just "assumed" that  considering it is named "Frank's Box"?
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008 1:08:05 P.M.  Central Standard Time, 
warrior18eii@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)   writes:

 
 
 
 
I  emailed Ryan that ya'll are trying to reach his producers. Maybe you will  
hear something back sooner.

Regards,

Frank  R.

----- Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@ _aol.com_ (http://aol.com/) " <Marlboro63@aol. com>
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 12:55:11  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State  Tonight


I emailed them and am hoping  for a response back too.  But I doubt I will 
get  it.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 2/18/2008  12:38:40 P.M. Central Standard Time, 
ghostchasingfool@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)   writes:

 
 
 
That's ok Nellie, I will be setting the record straight pretty  soon with the 
help of some dear friends.   

Juli

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@ _live.com_ (http://live.com/) >  wrote:

 
I e-mailed them--no response. I don't think they are all that  
concerned with facts.

Frank-S
--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroups  .com_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , 
rednellie <rednellie@. ..> wrote:
>
> I  just ran across this episode description on A&E website:
>  
> "PRS explores the belly of the beast: a New York State Prison  that 
was 
> once a mental asylum. Ryan and his team go  behind bars to uncover 
the 
> institution' s paranormal past  and present--current inmates and 
guards 
> are reporting  mysterious new sightings! For their biggest case yet 
PRS 
>  enlists the help of psychic Chip Coffey, demonologist Lorraine  
Warren 
> and Chris Moon, the owner/inventor of the latest  in paranormal 
> technology, "Frank's Box," a radio designed to  communicate with the 
dead"
> 
> I think they have  their details a bit wrong. :-P
> 
> 
>  Nellie
>
